concepts.POST-OPERATIVE_REFRACTION_(OPTIONAL_21_D: Information about the patient's refractive status after the operation, if available.
concepts.EYE_TO_BE_OPERATED_4_DESC: The eye designated for surgery, either the right or left.
concepts.REFRACTION_DETAILS_6_DESC: Information about the targeted post-operative spherical equivalent and the axis of astigmatism.
concepts.DATE_OF_OPERATION_10_DESC: The date on which the cataract surgery is performed
concepts.BEST_OR_PINHOLE_VA_5_DESC: The best-corrected visual acuity or pinhole visual acuity.
concepts.BIOMETRY_8_DESC: Measurements of the eye, including K1, K2 (corneal curvature), and axial length, used to calculate the intraocular lens (IOL) power.
concepts.PRESENTING_VISUAL_ACUITY_(VA)_3_DESC: The initial visual acuity of the patient before any intervention.
concepts.TYPE_OF_SURGERY_11_DESC: The method used for cataract extraction, such as ICCE (Intracapsular Cataract Extraction), ECCE (Extracapsular Cataract Extraction), SICS (Small Incision Cataract Surgery), or Phacoemulsification (Phaco)
concepts.SURGEON_ID_14_DESC: The unique identifier for the surgeon performing the operation.
concepts.PRESENTING_VA_AND_BEST_VA_19_DESC: The visual acuity of the operated eye at various follow-up visits, measured both as presenting and best-corrected VA.
concepts.CATEGORY_OF_VISUAL_ACUITY_(SNELLEN_6M)_1: The visual acuity measurement for both the right and left eyes using the Snellen chart at 6 meters.
concepts.PLACE_OF_OPERATION_16_DESC: The location of the surgery, such as a base hospital, other hospital, or out-of-hospital setting.
concepts.LENS_EXAMINATION_7_DESC: The condition of the lens, indicating whether it is clear or has opacities, and the readiness for surgery
concepts.TYPE_OF_INTRAOCULAR_LENS_(IOL)_13_DESC: The type of lens implanted, if any, such as PC IOL (Posterior Chamber Intraocular Lens), ACIOL (Anterior Chamber Intraocular Lens), or no IOL.
concepts.HOSPITAL/CAMP_ID_12_DESC: The identification number of the hospital or camp where the surgery takes place.
concepts.CAUSE_OF_PRESENTING_VISION_LESS_THAN_6/8: The reasons for suboptimal vision post-surgery if the visual acuity is less than 6/80.
concepts.OTHER_OCULAR_PATHOLOGIES_2_DESC: Any additional eye conditions that might affect the surgical outcome, such as corneal scars, old iritis, retinal disease, or glaucoma.
concepts.OPERATIVE_COMPLICATIONS_15_DESC: Any complications encountered during surgery, such as capsule rupture, vitreous loss, zonular dehiscence, or wound leak.
concepts.CAUSE_OF_PRESENTING_VISION_LESS_THAN_6/8: Cause of Presenting Vision less than 6/80
